title: store [common profiles]
description: The store object describes the exact physical storage of a layer and enables the client to detect when multiple layers are served from the same store. Storing multiple layers in a single store - and thus having them share resources - enables efficient serving of many layers of the same content type, but with different attribute schemas or different symbology applied.

id.description: A store ID, unique across a SceneServer. Enables the client to discover which layers are part of a common store, if any. {meshes, polygons, points, lines, analytics, meshpyramids, pointclouds, symbols}

profile.description: Indicates which profile this scene store fulfills.

enum-description.3dNodeIndexDocument: JSON file describes a single index node within a store, with links to other nodes (children, sibling, and parent), links to feature data, geometry data and texture data resources, metadata such as metrics used for LoD selection, its spatial extent. [Read more](3DNodeIndexDocument.cmn.md)
enum-description.SharedResource: Shared resources are models or textures that can be shared among features within the same layer.
enum-description.featureData: The FeatureData JSON file(s) contain geographical features with a set of attributes, accessors to geometry attributes and other references to styling or materials.
enum-description.Geometry: Each geometry resource is an array of geometries.
enum-description.Texture: The texture resource for a node contains the images that are used as textures for the features stored in the node.
enum-description.Attributes: Attribute resource for node containing feature data attributes

resourcePattern.description: Indicates the resources needed for rendering and the required order in which the client should load them.

rootNode.description: Relative URL to root node resource.

version.description: Format version of this resource; used here again if this store hasn't been served by a 3D Scene Server.

extent.description: The 2D spatial extent (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) of this store, in the horizontal indexCRS.

indexCRS.description: The horizontal CRS used for all minimum bounding spheres (mbs) in this store, identified by an OGC URL.

vertexCRS.description: The horizontal CRS used for all 'vertex positions' in this store, identified by an OGC URL.

enum-description.east-north-up: Normals are stored in a node local reference frame defined by the easting, northing and up directions at the MBS center, and is only valid for geographic (WGS84) vertexCRS.
enum-description.earth-centered: Normals are stored in a global earth-centered, earth-fixed (ECEF) reference frame where the x-axis points towards Prime meridian (lon = 0°) and Equator (lat = 0°), the y-axis points East towards lon = +90 and lat = 0 and the z-axis points North. It is only valid for geographic vertexCRS.  Default value for OGC.
enum-description.vertex-reference-frame: Normals are stored in the same reference frame as vertices and is only valid for projected vertexCRS.

normalReferenceFrame.description: Describes the coordinate reference frame used for storing normals.

nidEncoding.description: MIME type for the encoding used for the Node Index Documents. Example: application/vnd.esri.I3S.json+gzip; version=1.6.

featureEncoding.description: MIME type for the encoding used for the Feature Data Resources. For example: application/vnd.esri.I3S.json+gzip; version=1.6.

geometryEncoding.description: MIME type for the encoding used for the Geometry Resources. For example: application/octet-stream; version=1.6.

attributeEncoding.description: MIME type for the encoding used for the Attribute Resources. For example: application/octet-stream; version=1.6.

textureEncoding.description: MIME type(s) for the encoding used for the Texture Resources.

enum-description.MeshPyramid: Used for integrated mesh and 3D scene layer.
enum-description.Clustering: Fill in which profile types are using this lodType
enum-description.Generalizing: Fill in which profile types are using this lodType

lodType.description: Optional field to indicate which LoD generation scheme is used in this store.

enum-description.node-switching: A parent node is substituted for its children nodes when its lod threshold is exceeded. This implies that: parent and children are never shown at the same time.  The bounding volumne of the parent has to enclose the features of all grandchildren. Nodes have a single parent, except the root node that have no parent.

lodModel.description: Optional field to indicate the [LoD switching](lodSelection.cmn.md) mode.

indexingScheme.description: Information on the Indexing Scheme (QuadTree, R-Tree, Octree, ...) used.

defaultGeometrySchema.description: A common, global ArrayBufferView definition that can be used if the schema of vertex attributes and face attributes is consistent in an entire cache; this is a requirement for meshpyramids caches.

defaultTextureDefinition.description: A common, global TextureDefinition to be used for all textures in this store. The default texture definition uses a reduced profile of the full TextureDefinition, with the following attributes being mandatory: encoding, uvSet, wrap and channels.

defaultMaterialDefinition.description: If a store uses only one material, it can be defined here entirely as a MaterialDefinition.
